message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.AR 

The paper describes the development of machine learning tools for identifying potsherds based on images captured on site. This involves the use of deep learning architectures and image recognition techniques, which are typically associated with computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The challenges of working with real-world archaeological data, such as paucity of labeled data and extreme imbalance between instances of different categories, also suggest a focus on machine learning and data analysis, which are common themes in the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. Additionally, the need to integrate shape information from points along the inner and outer surfaces of potsherds suggests a potential connection to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. Finally, the use of machine learning for archaeological purposes suggests a potential connection to the augmented reality (cs.AR) sub-category, which involves the use of computer-generated images to enhance the perception of the real world.
